text:
Hi fellows, how do you find out the ip address of Docker Daemon on Docker toolbox (windows) ? 

I can't seem to be able to execute $ ip add

following this fabric setup guide <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/docs/Setup/Network-setup.md#leveraging-published-docker-images>
guys I'm following the basic tutorial for chaincode deployment

2016/09/11 16:16:50 grpc: addrConn.resetTransport failed to create client transport: connection error: desc = "transport: dial tcp 0.0.0.0:7051: getsockopt: connection refused"; Reconnecting to {"0.0.0.0:7051" <nil>}
I keep getting this for some reason
can anyone help ?
running this on Mac
<@U1CTBUNEN> which tutorial are you following ?
<@U0ULK2JPP>: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/docs/Setup/Chaincode-setup.md#running-the-chaincode>
I'm trying this on a Mac
I'm not 100% clear what's the difference between Docker Toolbox and Docker
on a Mac
so you are not running it in vagrant ?
no
ok
that instruction is targetted towards running everything (peer, chaincode etc) in the vagrant environment
how are you running the peer ?
ok may be the anchor link was related to vagrant
but I'm following the Docker instructions
<@U0ULK2JPP> <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/docs/Setup/Chaincode-setup.md#option-2-docker-for-mac-or-windows>
ok
this is how I'm running the pper
can you do `docker ps` please
in the end you need to override the default peer address with something like `CORE_PEER_ADDRESS=<peer’s address in container>:7051 peer chaincode deploy ….`

MARTINs-MacBook-Pro:chaincode_example02 martinmateev$ docker ps
CONTAINER ID        IMAGE                           COMMAND                  CREATED              STATUS              PORTS                                                      NAMES
39484c4782bb        hyperledger/fabric-peer         "sh -c 'sleep 5; peer"   About a minute ago   Up About a minute   0.0.0.0:7050-7051->7050-7051/tcp, 0.0.0.0:7053->7053/tcp   hyperledger_vp0_1
d9e5976f5374        hyperledger/fabric-membersrvc   "membersrvc"             About a minute ago   Up About a minute   0.0.0.0:7054->7054/tcp                                     hyperledger_membersrvc_1
ok
that’s got a mapped address … can you do `netstat -an | grep LISTEN | grep 705`

MARTINs-MacBook-Pro:chaincode_example02 martinmateev$ netstat -an | grep LISTEN 
tcp4       0      0  127.0.0.1.55730        *.*                    LISTEN     
tcp4       0      0  *.5432                 *.*                    LISTEN     
tcp6       0      0  *.5432                 *.*                    LISTEN     
tcp4       0      0  *.88                   *.*                    LISTEN     
tcp6       0      0  *.88                   *.*                    LISTEN     
tcp4       0      0  *.445                  *.*                    LISTEN     
tcp6       0      0  *.445                  *.*                    LISTEN     
tcp4       0      0  *.548                  *.*                    LISTEN     
tcp6       0      0  *.548                  *.*                    LISTEN
should i be following: Option 2 Docker for Mac or Windows or Option 3 Docker Toolbox
gimme a few mins … let me check
you are running option 2 currently ?
yeah option 2
ok
that should be ok
I have not tried this option myself… here’s my chance. Can I get back to you ?
hopefully shouldn’t take too long
sure
what options have you tried ?
all within vagrant
not the docker on Mac options (shame on me :slightly_smiling_face: )
it's very frustrating because I'm following the instructions step by step
it looks like this port is open but it still doesn't work for me

MARTINs-MacBook-Pro:chaincode_example02 martinmateev$ CORE_CHAINCODE_ID_NAME=mycc CORE_PEER_ADDRESS=0.0.0.0:55730 ./chaincode_example02
17:22:59.589 [shim] DEBU : Peer address: 0.0.0.0:55730
17:22:59.590 [shim] DEBU : os.Args returns: [./chaincode_example02]
17:22:59.590 [shim] DEBU : Registering.. sending REGISTER
2016/09/11 17:22:59 transport: http2Client.notifyError got notified that the client transport was broken unexpected EOF.
17:22:59.595 [shim] ERRO : Received error from server: rpc error: code = 13 desc = transport is closing, ending chaincode stream
Error starting Simple chaincode: rpc error: code = 13 desc = transport is closing
so this is what I did…ran the chaincode in a container (just like the peer is ran in one via docker-compose)
first I did `docker inspect | grep IPAddress` to get the IPAddress of the peer
which was 172.17.0.2
then
docker run --rm -it hyperledger/fabric-peer /bin/bash
cd examples/chaincode/go/chaincode_example02
CORE_PEER_ADDRESS=172.17.0.2:7051 CORE_CHAINCODE_ID_NAME=mycc ./chaincode_example02
this at least gets you one way
is that good for now ?
let me try
(of course, you;d need a `go build` before starting the chaincode
also to make it easy on myself, disabled security
this is my yml

vp0:
  image: hyperledger/fabric-peer
  environment:
    - CORE_PEER_ADDRESSAUTODETECT=true
    - CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=<http://172.17.0.1:2375>
    - CORE_PEER_ID=vp0
  command: sh -c "sleep 5; peer node start --peer-chaincodedev”
hmm
this doesn't seem to be working for me either
essentially - I think this is my problem: <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39090455/docker-option2-transport-is-closing-error>
I will try to upgrade docker
hmmm I wonder…
can you paste the chaincode terminal please
one sec
sure
I'm downloading the docker images again (since I reinstalled Docker)
so if I want to run this whole thing on a EC2 linux instance
I'd be better off with vagrant ?
ok
for a typical test/dev type of env, Vagrant is good - mainly because it has been used so much.
but it does assume additional burdent of having to install and setup vagrant env
this is starting to feel like that movie Inception: a container within a container within a container
the docker approach (Option 2) was quite quick for me…. I had to start from scratch and was able to get it up in quick time
:slightly_smiling_face:
I know
but I’ve been using vagrant and don’t think about it too much
btw
in vagrant I run peer, memberservice etc in command line
so its just one level
and if running in peer-chaincodedev, there no docker involvement at all
got it
I understand that the CA member service is an important piece but I can't find documentation
how do I enroll users, create permissions, etc... (for a local deploy)
for example I was trying to run one of the IBM bluemix demo apps locally
and it turns out I need to create this json file with credentials
you can generate that from the web-based interface on Bluemix
but how would you create that if you attempt to run the thing locally
<https://github.com/IBM-Blockchain/marbles/blob/master/tutorial_part1.md#configure-the-sdk-for-your-blockchain-network>
I’ll defer to <@U0PB67X4K>  for membership questions and bluemix questions
<@U0PB67X4K|garisingh> has joined the channel
but does this help <http://hyperledger-fabric.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Setup/ca-setup/> ?
yeah to a certain degree - on how to run a local CA service
I'm trying to write a simple chaincode for my use case but I after days of struggle I still can't get to the point of testing my own code : ))
I understand this is all new and beta but good samples and tutorials are so important to get people on board
agreed
this is why I left the ethereum community
the whole thing was a big mess
the reason I got attracted to the hyperledger project was that I can write my chaincode in GO
as opposed uhh ... solidity
I’m biased but I like hyperledger :slightly_smiling_face:  …
can I suggest this
do developement without security (and memberservice etc) upto the point where you are going to need you chaincode to do things like roles etc
and then add member service and security to the mixture
yeah - thanks
this makes sense
sure thing. here to help!
<@U0ULK2JPP> are you familiar with chaincode data models
I understand right now there's a key-value DB as the backbone for state
correct
the state is all managed via key value storage
so I was exploring the IBM car lease demo
and in the beginning they were storing the vehicle's history in an array
<https://github.com/jpayne23/Car-Lease-Demo/blob/master/Chaincode/vehicle_log_code/vehicle_log.go>
right
but then they abandoned that approach
and were looking at the transactions themselves to figure out what happened to a particular vehicle
I have not followed that example closely ...
how do you mean _transactions themselves to figure out what happened to a particular vehicle_ ?
I’m sensing some sort of “dynamic” computation … ?

the current process is that we read through every block on the blockchain to read the transactions within it. These transactions store the function call to the chaincode (e.g. create_vehicle) and the arguments passed as well as the caller. In a transfer one of the arguments is the identity of the new owner.

Using this information we can build up the history of the vehicle using the function names as a guide as because we wrote the chaincode we know what the functions do in regards to the vehicle and the order of the arguments.
I see
so the application up the stack manages history instead of maintaining it in the ledger
there are likely many ways to do this
but this way does show the different access paths to the fabric
YAY
so upgrading Docker for Mac solved my issue
great!

Suppose that i'm deploying a chaincode that let authorized users to save, delete and search for specific data into the chaincode state. Without considering the actual space limitations of the node disc, may be cause problems if chaincode state size reaches an order of hundred gigabytes?
today there’s nothing to prevent from saving any amount. So yes, large data would likely cause problems
I should rephrase that … large data could cause problems and need for storing “large data sets” on the ledger would need a careful look at the the end to end application stack
<@U0ULK2JPP> now the other issue I'm experiencing is that IBM's bluemix hyperledger platform is not up-to-date with mainline hyperledger development
I'm trying to follow the <https://github.com/IBM-Blockchain/learn-chaincode> tutorial
but I'm not able to compile the sample code

# <http://github.com/f00bar/learn-chaincode/start|github.com/f00bar/learn-chaincode/start>
./chaincode_start.go:34: cannot use new(SimpleChaincode) (type *SimpleChaincode) as type shim.Chaincode in argument to shim.Start:
	*SimpleChaincode does not implement shim.Chaincode (wrong type for Init method)
		have Init(*shim.ChaincodeStub, string, []string) ([]byte, error)
		want Init(shim.ChaincodeStubInterface, string, []string) ([]byte, error)
right. that needs to be updated. Can you try changing `*shim.ChaincodeStub` with `shim.ChaincodeStubInterface` please ?
the docs have not caught up everywhere with recent changes to chaincode interface.
this particular change has to do with the ability to unit test chaincode with a beginnings of a framework for that
I'm just thinking that these kinds of issues will arise in the future as well
hopefully fewer, farther between as things settle down
but point taken
noob question : how would you model the POST command from this manual: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/docs/Setup/Chaincode-setup.md> ?
through curl?
or by invoking POST directly?
curl would work
so if I want to transform this
then it would be curl -X POST localhost:7050/registrar
I’d put the text `{ "enrollId": "jim", "enrollSecret": “6avZQLwcUe9b”}` in a file (say log.json)
and do curl -X POST -d@log.json <http://localhost:7050/registrar>
thanks a lot
it worked out well for declaring user
do you know how to supply credentials into a chaincode externalized within a json file?
I get the following error
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","error":{"code":-32602,"message":"Invalid params","data":"Must supply username for chaincode when security is enabled."
when I try to launch a sample code
ok, managed to resolve it with "secureContext" element
is it normal that I am getting an error related to my chaincodeID?

22:17:03.519 [rest] ProcessChaincode -> INFO 03e REST processing chaincode request...
22:17:03.520 [rest] processChaincodeDeploy -> INFO 03f REST deploying chaincode...

22:17:05.008 [chaincode] Launch -> ERRO 046 sending init failed(handler not found for chaincode mycc)
should I modify it somewhere?
ok, managed to  resolve that one as well
but I am stuck again after I tried to post a transaction from example2
from registration perspective all went fine
<@U1P1ZV6RF|matanyahu> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/matanyahu/F2AEEKU3S/registration_status.txt|registration status>
